theoryTitle: Aokiji's True Motivation for Sparing the Straw Hats
theoryText: Some fans theorize that Aokiji's decision to spare the Straw Hats wasn't just about the Crocodile incident, but that he saw potential in Luffy to challenge the World Government's corruption. His 'Lazy Justice' philosophy might indicate he's questioning the absolute justice upheld by the Marines.
author: One Piece Community Discussion

theoryText: This encounter may have been a test by Aokiji to see if Luffy was worthy of continuing his journey. By freezing Robin first and observing Luffy's reaction, Aokiji gauged the depth of the crew's bonds and Luffy's willingness to sacrifice himself for his nakama. The battle wasn't about capture, but assessment.
author: One Piece Community Discussion

theoryTitle: The Significance of Ice Time's Reversibility
theoryText: The fact that Aokiji's Ice Time can be reversed through careful thawing suggests he uses this technique as a non-lethal alternative to killing pirates. Unlike other Admirals who may use more permanent methods, Aokiji's freezing gives him the option to show mercy, aligning with his Lazy Justice philosophy.
